Txt_Talk_Lancel_Out_SUB_0_ACTOR_0110_010.Text: *: The village here ain't much to write home about, but we've got a right old humdinger of a shrine to make up for it!
*: She's a beaut! You should go and take a butcher's, mate. Most of the folks we get down here do.

Txt_Talk_Lancel_Out_SUB_0_ACTOR_0210_010.Text: *: G'day, love. Welcome to Lanson. It ain't much, but it's home.

Txt_Talk_Lancel_Out_SUB_0_ACTOR_0310_010.Text: *: G'day! Me old man runs the item shop round these parts. You should get yerself a Fading Jenny or two while yer in town.
*: They're bonzer, eh. You just rub yerself down with one, and hey presto<--->invisible! It's always good to have one handy.

Txt_Talk_Lancel_Out_SUB_0_ACTOR_0410_010.Text: *: This route here leads to a shrine they call Gaia's Navel. How's that for a daggy name?
*: But if you look at it on a map, it is sorta slap-bang where the old belly-button'd be, so it kinda makes sense, eh.
*: Just between you and me, I went on a little walkabout down there one time, to see what was what, y'know?
*: Crikey, did I ever run outta there with me tail between me legs. Screaming like a flaming galah, I was!

Txt_Talk_Lancel_Out_SUB_0_ACTOR_0510_010.Text: *: Goo day to you. (slurp) You don't happen to have <IndefSgl_I_NAME>, do you?
*: (slurp) Are you seriooze!? What kind of adventurer are you?
*: You do? Then you should goo to Edina and sneak into the castle! I used to do it all the slime!

Txt_Talk_Lancel_Out_SUB_0_VOLUME_0710_01.Text: {LEADER} calms the monster with a soothing voice and tells it about Monty's monster menagerie...

Txt_Talk_Lancel_Out_SUB_0_ACTOR_0910_010.Text: *: There's a slime that lives here unlike any I've ever seen. But as soon as I get close, the little wuss runs off! Maybe if I had some kind of disguise...
*: There was a cureslime that lived here not long back, but it seems the critter's gone walkabout now. Maybe it'd got sick of being chased around by a dodgy bloke like me...

Txt_Talk_Lancel_Inn_SUB_0_ACTOR_0110_010.Text: *: I finally found that shrine the locals are always banging on about... Pity none of them thought to tell me the door's locked!
*: There must be a key for it, there simply must... But how am I supposed to find it? I don't even know where to start looking!

Txt_Talk_Lancel_Inn_SUB_0_ACTOR_0120_010.Text: *: Zzz... Zzz... Where's that key... Zzz...

Txt_Talk_Lancel_WeaponShop_SUB_0_ACTOR_0.Text: *: I journey in search of the ultimate key.
*: It is said that a certain pot must be procured in order to obtain it.
*: But whatever can this fiendish clue signify? Is the key to be found inside the pot, perhaps?

Txt_Talk_Lancel_TempleEast_SUB_0_ACTOR_0.Text: *: The yellow orb is forever travelling... Forever moving from hand to hand...
*: This makes it difficult to locate, even for one who possesses the echo flute...

Txt_Talk_Lancel_TempleWest_SUB_0_ACTOR_0.Text: *: Hmm... Yes... I see it... The face of your companion... The one you left behind! Ah, but is it the past I see, or that which is yet to come...?
*: No matter! I will say only this<--->that even those we leave behind may have a part to play on the road ahead.

Txt_Talk_Lancel_Temple_SUB_0_ACTOR_0110_.Text: *: So, brave {LEADER}, you have come! Welcome. Welcome to the shrine where the bravery of heroes is put to the ultimate test.
*: Do you possess the courage to trust in your own strength? To stand alone against your enemies?
*: Your honesty does you proud. If you have a companion that is ready to face the test, then have them speak with me. Farewell, now.

Txt_Talk_Lancel_Bridge_SUB_0_ACTOR_0110_.Text: *: But what is this, {LEADER}? We cannot have you dying! What kind of example would that set?
*: Will you attempt the trial once more?
*: Then you must leave this place. Begone.

Txt_Talk_Lancel_Bridge_SUB_0_VOLUME_0010.Text:
*: Now, go forth, brave {LEADER}!
Face your destiny alone!
You had us worried for a bit there! Good to see you back in one piece!
Never doubted you for a moment! Well done!
*: Strewth! Walk all over me big line, why don't ya? Pull yer head in and let me talk! Honestly... Ahem!
*: So, you have returned to us unharmed!
*: And how did you find your quest? Were you steadfast even in solitude?
*: But of course. You are a lone wolf. A solitary soul. It was foolish of me to ask.
*: You were? Your strength of spirit is impressive indeed.
*: For a confirmed {WORD}, walking the path of the trial cannot have been easy. You have earned my admiration.
*: Were you brave without companions to aid you, I wonder? Perhaps that is best left between you and the Goddess...
*: Now, it is time you were on your way.
*: Whatever is the matter? Not feeling up to the task, perhaps?
*: Entirely understandable. There is no need to proceed if you do not feel ready yet.
*: Ah, but you are headed the wrong way. You must go westwards.
